page.title: 09Culmstock after World War 1
page.content: Many of the old cottages in Culmstock have been pulled down.Three cottages which were where the garage is now had a trap door outside with steps leading down to the well where they used to get their water.The old train,which stopped carrying passengers in l963 provided many days out especially to Exeter for shopping.One of the best days of the year would be Culmstock Fair when the windows of all the houses would be boarded up by eight o'clock in the morning so that the cattle could be turned loose onto the streets controlled,it was hoped,by their owners.The sheep would be penned behind the vicarage and the auction would begin.At lunch time the dealers would be given free bread,cheese and cider.The local boys were welcome to a share of the bread and cheese but there was very little spare cider!
